item.title: U.S. Stock Indexes Try to Balance Trump Tariff Threats, AI Enthusiasm
item.description: The S&P 500 edged higher. The Nasdaq Composite slipped, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average advanced. President Trump told business leaders to make...

item.title: Gold Futures Slip But Stay Close to Highs on Safe-Haven Demand
item.description: Gold futures fall, though they sit higher on-week on safe-haven demand. Futures are down 0.3% at $2,763.50 a troy ounce.

item.title: Behind MicroStrategy's Bitcoin Bet: Investors Who Usually Play It Safe
item.description: “Bitcoin bonds” offer insurers a less risky way to purchase cryptocurrency.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Inventories Fall Less Than Expected
item.description: U.S. natural gas supplies fell by 223 billion cubic feet last week to 2,892 billion cubic feet, reducing surplus inventories.

item.title: Dollar Likely to Remain Firm in Near Term
item.description: The WSJ dollar index was little changed and was seen likely to remain elevated in the first half of the year before gradually falling.
